Textos e Roteiros

Kennel - Guião

Logline:

A tormented middled-aged man reluctantly agrees to spend a few days in his sister's country house in order to provide himself with some relief from the mounting confusion of his mental landscape

--------------------------------

Jackson Hayes has been struggling recently. The dark, distorted figure he sees in his dreams can either be a representation of his own shadow, or perhaps a separate, outside entity finding his way to him. Either way, it's taking a toll on his personal and professional life. An architect by trade, Jackson is about to complete the biggest job of his career: a sixteen story commercial building located downtown, not far from his own residential area. His wife is very much aware that something is amiss, but Jackson has a difficult time defining exactly what That is. He is an honest man, but like any intellectually confident person, he is a bit reluctant to jump to conclusions about the state of his psyche. Like summers past, the two will spend a couple of weeks at Jackson's sister's (Alice) lakehouse, this time with a more meaningful purpose: to disentangle the pressure, to relax the unraveled mind. But tension within oneself tends to be insidious, affecting all others around. Alice in particular seems attuned for that kind of unraveling. Only she seems to effectively tap into Jackson's strange brew of ideas. Deep down, for some time now, he has felt that the time for something to happen is approaching...

Page count: 118
Category: Thriller/Horror
Kennel

A Greater Honesty - Guião

Logline:

An unemployed single father living on a small budget tries to impart his own brand of loose morality onto his eight-year old son, despite suffering himself from an acute lack self-consciousness and discipline.

--------------------------------

Richard and Danny have an interesting father-son relationship. Richard is fully aware of what shortcomings his son should avoid getting stuck with while living his life, and he tries to teach him what to do, in each situation, with a respectable amount of honesty, sometimes not paying any mind to the fact that his son is just an eight-year old boy. The problem is, that awareness is often times rooted in a one-way traffic state of mind. Is he willingly blind as to how much responsability he usually discards himself of, or does just not care? Richard strikes big one night in the casino, and he immedeately plans a trip for him and his son to go on, advertised as a no-worries, no-plans-ahead type of escapade, much to the derision of Richard's acquaintances.

Numero de Páginas: 123
Categoria: Drama/Comédia
A Greater Honesty

Viajantes - Conto

Um pequeno mas denso exercicio na exploração de viveres opostos e dos seus unificantes; teimosamente criteriosos, sempre presentes. Escrevo sobre uma breve interação entre três pessoas no decorrer de uma viagem de metro, e sobre como uma unica memória pode influenciar, tácitamente, por mais fugidia que esta seja, todo o precurso mental da vida futura do individuo.
